definition: to write without lifting one's pen from the paper/(in the Romanization of Chinese) to write two or more syllables together as a single word (not separated by spaces)
to link/to join/to connect/continuously/in succession/including/(used with 也[ye3], 都[dou1] etc) even/company (military)

sentences.english: Can't John at least take the trouble to write a note of thanks?
sentences.chinese: 难道约翰连写封感谢信这最起码的事也做不到？

sentences.english: When Dorian had finished the letter, he felt that he had been forgiven.
sentences.chinese: 当道连写完这封信后，他感觉自己已经被原谅了。

sentences.english: He writes mostly with linked strokes, that I can hardly distinguish.
sentences.chinese: 连写的很多，我都不大认得出来。

sentences.english: Link writing for Chinese words has the necessity.
sentences.chinese: 实行中文分词连写确实具有必要性。

sentences.english: The paper has been written word-segmentedly.
The coach gave his team a chalk talk before the game.
sentences.chinese: 教练在比赛前给队员们连写带画地讲解了一番。

definition: to write without lifting one's pen from the paper
to write without lifting one's pen from the paper/(in the Romanization of Chinese) to write two or more syllables together as a single word (not separated by spaces)
to take up one's pen/to start to write
to transcribe/to make a fair copy
to finish (a letter, a painting) at a stroke
style of writing (literary style)/way of writing a character/spelling
to write on behalf of sb/to ghostwrite
